column1: Nigerian cities are categorized into three types; there is the "Metropolis"
column2: which is characterized with having more than one Local Government Areas (LGAs). This type of cities are usually formed when large municipalities are split into smaller LGAs
column3: to aid efficient administration and management
column4: or when small towns grow and merge into existing large cities
column5: or both; some are also formed when urban areas of multiple LGAs merge as a result of growth and are now fully defined as a single settlement
column6: Another type of settlement is the "Municipality"
column7: which is basically an LGA that is fully defined as its own city or town. This type of cities are usually mid-sized
column8: although some large cities also exist as a single LGA. The third type of settlement is the "village"
column9: which is basically grouped together with several other villages into one sizeable LGA.
